channel.title: vRealize Automation on vCROCS
channel.description: Recent content in vRealize Automation on vCROCS

item.title: VMware Aria Automation | Ansible Integration
item.description: VMware Aria Automation | Ansible Integration I was recently asked how the VMware Aria Automation | Ansible Integration worked. I never used Ansible before so I thought this would be great time to learn Ansible and demo the integration with VMware Aria Automation.

item.title: VMware PowerBlock | August 2022
item.description: VMware PowerBlock | August 2022 The August PowerBlock is absolutely going to be a well attended event. We are gong to have an all-star lineup, of highly qualified automation engineers, including Ariel Sanchez, Tom Gillaspy, Chris McClanahan, Dale Hassinger and our powerblock discussing a variety of topics.

item.title: Year in Review - 2021 | 2022 Goals
item.description: Get-Review 2021 2021 was a good year for me with my career. I spent the entire year working from home and I find myself to be more productive when WFH.

item.title: SaltConf 2021 - SaltStack Config Session
item.description: I will be doing a SaltConf presentation for the first time at SaltConf 2021. I attended SaltConf 2020 for the first time after VMware purchased SaltStack Config.

item.title: VMworld 2021 - SaltStack Config Session
item.description: Manage Windows Workloads Through vRealize Automation SaltStack Config [MCL1895] I will be doing a VMworld presentation for the first time at VMworld 2021.

item.title: How to use PowerShell Modules with vRA 8.2
item.description: Options to use PowerShell Modules I like to review VMware vRA (vRealize Automation) 8.2 as a Microsoft Windows Server Admin.

item.title: How to be successful with VMware vRealize Products in your environment
item.description: I often get asked to speak to different organizations about what I have accomplished with the VMware vRealize Suite of products.

item.title: Welcome to www.vCROCS.info
item.description: Your Source for Automation/Monitoring/Logging Content I have learned a lot from the vCommunity, Powershell and PowerCLI web sites. I want to use this blog as a way for me to give back.
